title: 3d Printed Knee Hockey Target
author: THeGoalie
steps: I have been playing more and more knee hockey with my siblings, so when I want to beat them. I break these out for a better shot. I have been for now been going bar down on them.
All you need is a little glue for the clamp to put it onto the target.
Take finished print off build plate.
Add clue to clamp in the crevasse.

title: Building a Coffee Table With Endless Depth! (Infinity Illusion)
author: NavinK30
steps: This infinity mirror table blendsmodern design with optical illusion artistry. Built with asolid mirror at the baseand aone-way mirror on top, it creates a captivatingendless light-tunnel effect. Inside the table,staircase-pattern LED bulbs, neatly routed with ropes and pipes, enhance the illusion of depth and infinity.

Materials Used in the Infinity Mirror Table ProjectWood -Playwood and flexi playwood.Brick Texture Wallpaper– gives the inner wall a realistic, tunnel-like appearance.Regular Mirror (Bottom)– placed at the base to reflect light and objects above.One-Way Mirror (Top Glass)– creates the infinity illusion when paired with the bottom mirror.PVC Pipes (Small Sections)– used to make the mini staircase frame.C-Shaped Metal Rod– added on one side for a climbing effect.Ropes– used as steps for the staircase structure.LED Bulbs and Holders:Installed to create the glowing infinity bulb series effect..Power Supply Box (DIY Control Unit)– includes:BatteryDC Charging PortPush Button SwitchToggle SwitchWhite Laminate Sheet– applied on the upper and edge surfaces for a clean, modern look.Wooden Laminate Sheet– added around the sides for a stylish finish and contrast.Adhesive & Screws– used to assemble and secure all parts.

Measure and mark the table outline on the plywood using a measuring tape and a straight edge to ensure perfectly accurate dimensions. After marking, cut the plywood into a precise square shape to serve as the base support for the mirror. Next, use a router—just like shown—to smoothly round all four corners. This cordless router delivers clean, consistent curves and gives the panel a modern, professional finish.

First,cut the side wallsof the frame to match the final depth of your table, ensuring they are sized to fit the perimeter of your base panel. You will need two long sides and two short sides.Next,apply a generous amount of wood gluealong the edges where the side walls meet the base panel. Place the side walls onto the base andsecure them with screwsusing a drill, driving them through the base into the wall pieces.Finally, attach the remaining two side walls to complete the rectangular box structure, making sure the entire inner frame issquare and tightly secured. This box is what creates the depth for the infinity mirror effect.

First,measure and cutfour identical wooden pieces that will form the curved ends of your table.Next,clamp these curved piecesfirmly to the short ends of your rectangular frame. Use a generous amount of wood glue and clamps to ensure a secure bond while the glue dries.Finally, furthersecure the curved piecesby nailing them into the frame using small nails or brads. Once fully assembled, the box will have a perfectly rounded rectangular shape, ready for the next layer of detail.

First,cut the flexible wood sheetsto match the exterior dimensions of your table sides. Apply contact cement or a strong adhesive to both the wood sheet and the table frame, then carefully press the wood onto the frame.Next,repeat the process with your white laminate. Cut the laminate to size and bond it securely to the flexible wood underlayer using adhesive. This two-step process ensures a smooth, stable surface over the rounded corners.Finally, once the adhesive is cured,trim any excess laminatefrom the edges and corners using a sharp utility knife or a router with a flush trim bit for a clean, professional finish.

First,prepare the slatted material. This is a flexible sheet of decorative laminate or wood veneer pre-cut into strips. It needs to be flexible enough to bend smoothly around the rounded corners of the table box. You can see the material being prepared with a router.Next,apply adhesivegenerously and evenly to the entire exterior surface below the white trim.Then,carefully lay the slatted claddingonto the frame, starting on one side. Press it firmly into place, ensuring the strips are vertical and that the sheet smoothly follows the curves of the corners. Usemasking tapeto temporarily hold the cladding in place on the curved sections until the glue is set.Finally, allow the adhesive to cure completely before removing the tape. Your table box is now fully finished on the exterior.

This step involves constructing a secondary, slightly smaller box that will fit inside your main table frame and serve as the display area for the infinity effect. This inner box will also be where the decorative elements are attached.Construct the Inner Box:Cut plywood or MDF pieces to form a box that is slightly smaller than the interior dimensions of your main table frame. This box should have the same rounded corners as your main frame. Glue and secure these pieces together firmly.Apply Brick Wallpaper:Carefully measure and cut the brick-patterned vinyl wallpaper to line theinsidewalls of this newly constructed inner box. Apply it smoothly, ensuring the pattern is continuous and free of bubbles, as this will be the infinitely reflected background.

Apply glue to the T-connector and fix the RO pipe firmly. Then attach the bulb holder to the connector and secure it tightly. Give black color to give a clean look. Finally, mount the light setup on the wall structure to create the glowing “well” effect for the infinity mirror table.

Cut and glue small PVC pieces onto longer PVC pipes to form the stair supports, then paint them for a clean finish.Drill holes in the vertical pipes and thread short rope sections through, securing them with screws and nuts to create the stair steps.Mount the assembled PVC-and-rope staircase inside the infinity mirror table frame.This setup gives a “stairway into the well” illusion when the mirror lights are turned on.

A flexible LED light strip is wrapped around a cylindrical tube to create a bright and even lighting element. This LED tube will be placed inside the setup to enhance the visual effect and provide illumination. The wrapped LED ensures consistent brightness and adds a decorative touch to the project. Additionally, a C-shaped metal rod is installed on the side to provide a climbing or support effect.

In this step, aregular mirroris first placed at the bottom to create the reflective base. Next, thewell effect setupwith lights, rods, and decorations is positioned above it. Finally, aone-way mirroris carefully installed on top, completing the setup. Together, these layers create the stunninginfinity mirror effect, giving the illusion of endless depth and glowing light.

Turn on the power switch from the control box to illuminate the endless LED infinity bulb series inside the table.As the lights reflect between the regular and one-way mirrors, they create a mesmerizing illusion of endless glowing depth.You’ll notice a beautiful staircase-like effect that appears to descend infinitely, enhancing the visual appeal.Place your table in the desired location, add your cup or decor on top, and enjoy the mesmerizing infinity illusion effect — a perfect blend of art and functionality!
